Subjective: Trouble passing hard stools for 3 months. Infrequent bowel movements (every 2-3 days). Abdominal pain and cramps. Bloating. No blood in stool. No change in appetite or eating habits. Underweight. Request: Concern about seriousness of condition and desire for softer stools.
Objective: Abdomen: tender to palpation in lower left quadrant. Varying tympani and dampening on percussion. Normal bowel sounds. No masses or guarding.
Plan: 1. Psyllium fibre sachets daily with plenty of water for 6 weeks. 2. Follow-up in 6 weeks to evaluate results. 3. Safety net: contact if abdominal pain worsens, fever develops, or blood appears in stool. 4. Consider referral to dietician for weight management.
